title: Does defensive playing offset skill?
body: So most games I find that my kda is pretty decent and whatnot but I'm a huge sissy until I get a few items under my belt. I don't have a lot of skill with this game but because of my defensive playing I've seemed to be passable. Is that a good tactic or should I learn how to calculate damage potential with each champ? In other words, my greatest fear is blowing my full combo and falling short by a 100 or so hp and dying. I'm not very good at all of this stuff like animation canceling and fine skill mechanics so would that really put me out of the ranking system? Do I need to watch youtube videos on all this stuff, and if so, which champion should I thoroughly learn that seems pretty balanced from mid to late game (since I hate early game.) I like cc and teamfight potential but also prefer to be somewhat capable of soloing if my team doesn't know what a map is or something similar :)
